member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.InterpolateShape
member.summary: Creates 3D features by interpolating z-values from a surface.

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

The input features to process. (In, Required)
The feature class that will be produced by this tool. (Out, Required)

member.summary: The LAS dataset, raster, TIN, or terrain surface used for interpolating z-values. (In, Required)

member.summary: The input features to process. (In, Required)

member.summary: The feature class that will be produced by this tool. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.InterpolateShape.sample_distance
member.summary: The spacing at which z-values will be interpolated. By default, this is a raster dataset's cell size or a triangulated surface's natural densification. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.InterpolateShape.z_factor
member.summary: The factor by which Z values will be multiplied. This is typically used to convert Z linear units to match XY linear units. The default is 1, which leaves elevation values unchanged. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.InterpolateShape.method
member.summary: Interpolation method used to determine elevation values for the output features. The available options depend on the surface type being used: (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.InterpolateShape.vertices_only
member.summary: Specifies whether the interpolation will only occur along the vertices of an input feature, thereby ignoring the sample distance option. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.InterpolateShape.pyramid_level_resolution
member.summary: The z-tolerance or window-size resolution of the terrain pyramid level that will be used by this tool. The default is 0, or full resolution. (In, Optional)

member.param: The TIN dataset to process. (In, Required)

param.name: out_raster
param.summary: The location and name of the output raster. When storing a raster dataset in a geodatabase or in a folder such as an Esri Grid, no file extension should be added to the name of the raster dataset. member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.AddZInformation.noise_filtering
member.summary: An optional numeric value used to exclude portions of features from the resulting calculations. This can be useful when the 3D input contains relatively small features with extreme slopes which may bias statistical results. If the 3D input's linear units are meters, specifying a value of 0.001 will result in the exclusion of lines or polygon edges that are shorter than 0.001 meters. For multipatch features, the same value will result in the exclusion of its subparts that have an area less than 0.001 square meters. This parameter does not apply to point and multipoint features. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LocateOutliers
member.summary: Identifies anomalous elevation measurements from terrain, TIN, or LAS datasets that exceed a defined range of elevation values or have slope characteristics that are inconsistent with the surrounding surface.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LocateOutliers.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The terrain, TIN, or LAS dataset that will be analyzed. (In, Required)
The feature class that will be produced by this tool. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LocateOutliers.in_surface
member.summary: The terrain, TIN, or LAS dataset that will be analyzed. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LocateOutliers.out_feature_class
member.summary: The feature class that will be produced by this tool. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LocateOutliers.apply_hard_limit
member.summary: Specifies use of absolute Z minimum and maximum to find outliers. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LocateOutliers.absolute_z_min
member.summary: If hard limits are applied, then any point with an elevation below this value will be considered as being an outlier. The default is 0. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LocateOutliers.absolute_z_max
member.summary: If hard limits are applied, then any point with an elevation above this value will be considered as being an outlier. The default is 0. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LocateOutliers.apply_comparison_filter
member.summary: The comparison filter consists of three parameters for determining outliers (z_tolerance, slope_tolerance, and exceed_tolerance_ratio). (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LocateOutliers.z_tolerance
member.summary: Used to compare Z values of neighboring points if the comparison filter is applied. The default is 0. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LocateOutliers.slope_tolerance
member.summary: The threshold of slope variance between consecutive points that would be used to identify outlier points. Slope is expressed as a percentage, with the default being 150. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LocateOutliers.exceed_tolerance_ratio
member.summary: Defines the criteria for determining each outlier point as a function of the ratio of points in its natural neighborhood that must exceed the specified comparison filters. For example, the default value of 0.5 means at least half of the points surrounding the query point must exceed the comparison filters for the query point to be flagged as an outlier. A value of 0.7 means at least 70 percent of the neighbor points must exceed the tolerances. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LocateOutliers.outlier_cap
member.summary: The maximum number of outlier points that can be written to the output. Once this value is reached, no further outliers are sought. The default is 2,500. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

The 3D features that will either be lines that represent the skyline or multipatches that represent silhouettes. (Out, Required)

member.summary: The 3D points representing observers. Each feature will have its own output. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.out_feature_class
member.summary: The 3D features that will either be lines that represent the skyline or multipatches that represent silhouettes. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.in_surface
member.summary: The topographic surface that will be used to define the horizon. If no surface is provided, then a virtual surface will be employed using the virtual_surface_radius and virtual_surface_elevation parameters. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.virtual_surface_radius
member.summary: The radius of the virtual surface that will be used to define the horizon when a topographic surface is not provided. The default is 1,000 meters. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.virtual_surface_elevation
member.summary: The elevation of the virtual surface for defining the horizon in lieu of an actual surface. It is ignored if an actual surface is provided. The default is 0. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.in_features
member.summary:
The features used in determining the skyline. If no features are specified, then the skyline will consist solely of the horizon line as defined by the topographic or virtual surface.
(In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.feature_lod
member.summary: The level of detail at which each feature should be examined in the skyline analysis. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.from_azimuth_value_or_field
member.summary: From Azimuth (in, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.to_azimuth_value_or_field
member.summary: The direction, in degrees, at which the skyline analysis should be completed. The analysis starts from the observer point and goes to the right, from the From Azimuth until the To Azimuth is reached. Must be no more than 360 greater than the From Azimuth. The default is 360. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.azimuth_increment_value_or_field
member.summary: The angular interval, in degrees, at which the horizon should be evaluated while conducting the skyline analysis between the From Azimuth and the To Azimuth. Must be no greater than the To Azimuth minus the From Azimuth. The default is 1. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.max_horizon_radius
member.summary: The maximum distance for which a horizon should be sought from the observer location. A value of zero indicates that there should be no limit imposed. The default is 0. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.segment_skyline
member.summary: Determines whether the resulting skyline will have one feature for each observer point, or if each observer's skyline will be segmented by the unique elements that contribute to the skyline. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.scale_to_percent
member.summary: Indicates to what percent of the original vertical angle (angle above the horizon, or angle of elevation) or elevation each skyline vertex should be placed. If either 0 or 100 is entered, then no scaling will occur. The default is 100. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The values according to which the scaling should be determined. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.scale_method
member.summary: The vertex to be used to calculate against. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Indicates whether the earth's curvature should be taken into consideration when generating the ridgeline from a functional surface. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.use_refraction
member.summary: Indicates whether atmospheric refraction will be applied when generating the ridgeline from a functional surface. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.refraction_factor
member.summary: The refraction coefficient to be used if atmospheric refraction is being considered. The default is 0.13. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LineOfSight
member.summary: Determines the visibility of sight lines over obstructions consisting of a surface and an optional multipatch dataset.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LineOfSight.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The LAS dataset, raster, TIN, or terrain surface used in determining visibility. (In, Required)

The line features whose first vertex defines the observation point and last vertex identifies the target location. Height of the observation and target locations are obtained from the z-values of 3D features and interpolated from the surface for 2D features. (In, Required)

The output line feature class along which visibility has been determined. Two attribute fields are created. VisCode indicates visibility along the line, 1 being visible and 2 not visible. TarIsVis indicates the target visibility, 0 being not visible and 1 being visible. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LineOfSight.in_surface
member.summary: The LAS dataset, raster, TIN, or terrain surface used in determining visibility. (In, Required)

member.summary: The line features whose first vertex defines the observation point and last vertex identifies the target location. Height of the observation and target locations are obtained from the z-values of 3D features and interpolated from the surface for 2D features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LineOfSight.out_los_feature_class
member.summary: The output line feature class along which visibility has been determined. Two attribute fields are created. VisCode indicates visibility along the line, 1 being visible and 2 not visible. TarIsVis indicates the target visibility, 0 being not visible and 1 being visible. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LineOfSight.out_obstruction_feature_class
member.summary: An optional point feature class identifying the location of the first obstruction on the observer's sight line to its target. (Out, Optional)

member.summary: Indicates whether the earth's curvature should be taken into consideration for the line-of-sight analysis. For this option to be enabled, the surface needs to have a defined spatial reference in projected coordinates with defined z-units. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.EditTin.constrained_delaunay
member.summary: A constrained Delaunay triangulation conforms to Delaunay rules everywhere except along breaklines. When using conforming Delaunay triangulation, breaklines are densified by the software; therefore, one input breakline segment can result in multiple triangle edges. When using constrained Delaunay triangulation no densication occurs and each breakline segment is added as a single edge. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.AddTerrainPyramidLevel
member.summary: Adds one or more pyramid levels to an existing terrain dataset.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.AddTerrainPyramidLevel.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The terrain dataset to process. (In, Required)

The z-tolerance or window size and its associated reference scale for each pyramid level being added to the terrain. Each pyramid level is entered as a space-delimited pair of the pyramid level resolution and reference scale (for example, "20 24000" for a window size of 20 and reference scale of 1:24000, or "1.5 10000" for a z-tolerance of 1.5 and reference scale of 1:10000). The pyramid level resolution can be provided as a floating-point value, while the reference scale must be entered as a whole number. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.AddTerrainPyramidLevel.in_terrain
member.summary: The terrain dataset to process. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.AddTerrainPyramidLevel.pyramid_type
member.summary: The pyramid type used by the terrain dataset. This parameter is not used in ArcGIS 9.3 and beyond, as its purpose is to ensure backward-compatibility with scripts and models written using ArcGIS 9.2. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.AddTerrainPyramidLevel.pyramid_level_definition
member.summary: The z-tolerance or window size and its associated reference scale for each pyramid level being added to the terrain. Each pyramid level is entered as a space-delimited pair of the pyramid level resolution and reference scale (for example, "20 24000" for a window size of 20 and reference scale of 1:24000, or "1.5 10000" for a z-tolerance of 1.5 and reference scale of 1:10000). The pyramid level resolution can be provided as a floating-point value, while the reference scale must be entered as a whole number. (In, Required)

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The feature dataset that will contain the terrain dataset. (In, Required)
The name of the terrain dataset. (In, Required)

The average horizontal distance between the data points that will be used in modeling the terrain. Sensor based measurements, like photogrammetric, lidar, and sonar surveys, typically have a known spacing that should be used. The spacing should be expressed in the horizontal units of the feature dataset's coordinate system. (In, Required)

member.summary: The feature dataset that will contain the terrain dataset. (In, Required)

member.summary: The name of the terrain dataset. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.CreateTerrain.average_point_spacing
member.summary: The average horizontal distance between the data points that will be used in modeling the terrain. Sensor based measurements, like photogrammetric, lidar, and sonar surveys, typically have a known spacing that should be used. The spacing should be expressed in the horizontal units of the feature dataset's coordinate system. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.CreateTerrain.max_overview_size
member.summary: The terrain overview is akin to the image thumbnail concept. It is the coarsest representation of the terrain dataset, and the maximum size represents the upper limit of the number of measurement points that can be sampled to create the overview. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.CreateTerrain.config_keyword
member.summary: The configuration keyword for optimizing the terrain's storage in an enterprise database. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.CreateTerrain.pyramid_type
member.summary: The point thinning method used to construct the terrain pyramids. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.CreateTerrain.windowsize_method
member.summary: The criterion used for selecting points in the area defined by the window size. This parameter is only applicable when WINDOWSIZE is specified in the pyramid_type parameter. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.CreateTerrain.secondary_thinning_method
member.summary: Specifies additional thinning options to reduce the number of points used over flat areas when Window Size pyramids are being used. An area is considered flat if the heights of points in an area are within the value supplied for the Secondary Thinning Threshold parameter. Its effect is more evident at higher-resolution pyramid levels, since smaller areas are more likely to be flat than larger areas. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.CreateTerrain.secondary_thinning_threshold
member.summary: The vertical threshold used to activate secondary thinning with the WINDOWSIZE filter. The value should be set equal to or larger than the vertical accuracy of the data. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The coordinate system of the input data. The default is an Unknown Coordinate System. If specified, the output may or may not be projected into a different coordinate system. This depends the whether the geoprocessing environment has a coordinate system defined for the location of the target feature class. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.ASCII3DToFeatureClass.average_point_spacing
member.summary: The average planimetric distance between points of the input. This parameter is only used when the output geometry is set to MULTIPOINT, and its function is to provide a means for grouping the points together. This value is used in conjunction with the points per shape limit to construct a virtual tile system used to group the points. The tile system's origin is based on the domain of the target feature class. Specify the spacing in the horizontal units of the target feature class. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.ASCII3DToFeatureClass.file_suffix
member.summary: The suffix of the files to import from an input folder. This parameter is required when a folder is specified as input. (In, Optional)

Multiple class codes can be entered as a semicolon-delimited string ("5 2; 8 3; 1 4"), a list of strings (for example, [[5, 2], [8, 3], [1, 4]]). (In, Required)

member.summary: This value indicates a vertical distance (in surface units) to be added to the z-value of each cell as it is considered for visibility. It should be a positive integer or floating point value. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Visibility.observer_elevation
member.summary: This value is used to define the surface elevations of the observer points or vertices. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Visibility.observer_offset
member.summary: This value indicates a vertical distance (in surface units) to be added to observer elevation. It should be a positive integer or floating point value. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Visibility.inner_radius
member.summary: This value defines the start distance from which visibility is determined. Cells closer than this distance are not visible in the output, but can still block visibility of the cells between inner radius and outer radius. It can be a positive or negative integer or floating point value. If it is a positive value, then it is interpreted as three-dimensional, line-of-sight distance. If it is a negative value, then it is interpreted as two-dimensional planimetric distance. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Visibility.outer_radius
member.summary: This value defines the maximum distance from which visibility is determined. Cells beyond this distance are excluded from the analysis. It can be a positive or negative integer or floating point value. If it is a positive value, then it is interpreted as three-dimensional, line-of-sight distance. If it is a negative value, then it is interpreted as two-dimensional planimetric distance. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Visibility.horizontal_start_angle
member.summary: This value defines the start angle of the horizontal scan range. The value should be specified in degrees from 0 to 360, with 0 oriented to north. The default value is 0. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Visibility.horizontal_end_angle
member.summary: This value defines the end angle of the horizontal scan range. The value should be specified in degrees from 0 to 360, with 0 oriented to north. The default value is 360. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Visibility.vertical_upper_angle
member.summary: This value defines the upper vertical angle limit of the scan above a horizontal plane. The value should be specified in degrees from 0 to 90, which can be integer or floating point. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Visibility.vertical_lower_angle
member.summary: This value defines the lower vertical angle limit of the scan below a horizontal plane. The value should be specified in degrees from -90 to 0, which can be integer or floating point. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.ClassifyLasByHeight
member.summary: Reclassifies lidar points based on their height from the ground surface.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.ClassifyLasByHeight.#ctor(System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: in_las_dataset
param.summary: The LAS dataset that will be processed. Only LAS points with class codes 0 and 1 will be reclassified. (In, Required)

param.name: ground_source
param.summary: The source of ground measurements that will be used to determine height above ground. (In, Required)

param.name: height_classification
param.summary: The class code value that will be assigned to LAS points that fall within the range of values derived from the specified height from ground. The order of entry influences the height ranges that are used to define the reclassification of LAS points. The first entry's Z-range will span from the ground surface to the specified height_from_ground value. The Z-range of subsequent entries will span from the upper limit of the preceding entry to its own height_from_ground value. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.ClassifyLasByHeight.in_las_dataset
member.summary: The LAS dataset that will be processed. Only LAS points with class codes 0 and 1 will be reclassified. (In, Required)

member.summary: The class code value that will be assigned to LAS points that fall within the range of values derived from the specified height from ground. The order of entry influences the height ranges that are used to define the reclassification of LAS points. The first entry's Z-range will span from the ground surface to the specified height_from_ground value. The Z-range of subsequent entries will span from the upper limit of the preceding entry to its own height_from_ground value. (In, Required)

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input surface raster. It can be an integer or a floating-point raster. (In, Required)
The input feature class that identifies the observer locations. It can be point, multipoint, or polyline features. (In, Required)
The output raster. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Viewshed2.in_raster
member.summary: The input surface raster. It can be an integer or a floating-point raster. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Viewshed2.in_observer_features
member.summary: The input feature class that identifies the observer locations. It can be point, multipoint, or polyline features. (In, Required)

member.summary: The output raster. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Viewshed2.out_agl_raster
member.summary: The output above ground level (AGL) raster. (Out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Viewshed2.analysis_type
member.summary: Choose which type of visibility analysis you wish to perform, either determining how visible each cell is to the observers, or identifying for each surface location which observers are visible. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Viewshed2.vertical_error
member.summary: The amount of uncertainty (the Root Mean Square error, or RMSE) in the surface elevation values. It is a floating-point value representing the expected error of the input elevation values. When this parameter is assigned a value greater than 0, the output visibility raster will be floating point. In this case, each cell value on the output visibility raster represents the sum of probabilities that the cell is visible to any of the observers. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Viewshed2.out_observer_region_relationship_table
member.summary: The output table for identifying the regions that are visible to each observer. This table can be related to the input observer feature class and the output visibility raster for identifying the regions visible to given observers. (Out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Viewshed2.refractivity_coefficient
member.summary: Coefficient of the refraction of visible light in air. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Viewshed2.surface_offset
member.summary: This value indicates a vertical distance (in surface units) to be added to the z-value of each target cell as it is considered for visibility. It should be a positive integer or floating-point value. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Viewshed2.observer_elevation
member.summary: This value is used to define the surface elevations of the observer points or vertices. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Viewshed2.observer_offset
member.summary: This value indicates a vertical distance (in surface units) to be added to observer elevation. It should be a positive integer or floating-point value. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Viewshed2.inner_radius
member.summary: This value defines the start (minimum) distance from which visibility is determined. Cells closer than this distance are considered not visible in the output but can still block visibility of the cells between the inner radius and the outer radius. The default value is 0. member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.RegularizeBuildingFootprint
member.summary: Normalizes the footprint of building polygons by eliminating undesirable artifacts in the geometry.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.RegularizeBuildingFootprint.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.String,System.Double)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: in_features
param.summary: The polygons that represent the building footprints to be regularized. (In, Required)

member.param: The feature class that will be produced by this tool. (Out, Required)

param.name: method
param.summary: The regularization method to be used in processing the input features. (In, Required)

param.name: tolerance
param.summary: The maximum distance that the regularized footprint can deviate from the boundary of its originating feature. The specified value will be based on the linear units of the input feature's coordinate system. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.RegularizeBuildingFootprint.in_features
member.summary: The polygons that represent the building footprints to be regularized. (In, Required)

member.summary: The feature class that will be produced by this tool. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.RegularizeBuildingFootprint.method
member.summary: The regularization method to be used in processing the input features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.RegularizeBuildingFootprint.tolerance
member.summary: The maximum distance that the regularized footprint can deviate from the boundary of its originating feature. The specified value will be based on the linear units of the input feature's coordinate system. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.RegularizeBuildingFootprint.densification
member.summary: The sampling interval that will be used to evaluate whether the regularized feature will be straight or bent. The densification must be equal to or less than the tolerance value. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.RegularizeBuildingFootprint.precision
member.summary: The precision used by the spatial grid employed in the regularization process. Valid values range from 0.05 to 0.25. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.RegularizeBuildingFootprint.diagonal_penalty
member.summary: Controls the distance bias for creating right-angle connections. Distances smaller than the diagonal penalty will be used to create right angles. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.RegularizeBuildingFootprint.min_radius
member.summary: The smallest radius that a regularized circle can have. A value of 0 implies there is no minimum size limit. This option is only available with the circle method. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.RegularizeBuildingFootprint.max_radius
member.summary: The largest radius that a regularized circular can have. This option is only available with the circle method. (In, Optional)
